protocol.purpose: Evaluate PR security properties from FAC-prepared local inputs, emit structured findings, and set a verdict. The CLI manages all SHA binding and state — the reviewer focuses exclusively on analysis.

commands.description: The reviewer uses exactly 3 CLI commands via `cargo run -p apm2-cli --`. This ensures the workspace-built binary is used, not a stale global install. No other commands are needed.
commands.prepare: cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review prepare --json
commands.finding: cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review finding --type security --severity <BLOCKER|MAJOR|MINOR|NIT> --summary "..." --risk "..." --impact "..." --location "..." --body "..." --json
commands.verdict: cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review verdict set --dimension security --verdict <approve|deny> --reason "..." --json

forbidden_operations: If you're testing local changes, remember not to use the $PATH installed `apm2` — use `cargo run -p apm2-cli --` so the workspace-built binary is used.
All interactions with the repository MUST be read-only. Do not modify any files.
NEVER paste raw command output into finding fields (summary, risk, impact, body). Finding fields must contain your original analysis text only.
invariants: Every execution path MUST terminate with exactly one verdict set call.
SHA is managed by the CLI — the reviewer never tracks, stores, or references it.

ALWAYS use `cargo run -p apm2-cli --` instead of bare `apm2`. The workspace binary contains the code under review; a globally installed binary may be stale and missing fields or fixes from the current PR.

Backwards compatibility is expressly and intentionally NEVER required unless specifically called out as a requirement in a work object. Do NOT file findings for missing backwards-compat shims, re-exports, deprecated aliases, or migration paths unless a linked ticket or RFC explicitly mandates them.

references.purpose: Truth/projection model, containment, and verification laws.
PCAC/AJC lifecycle integration checks for authority-bearing handlers.
Primitive soundness invariants: type validity, initialization, pointer provenance, aliasing.
Macro expansion security, hidden unsafe, cfg-dependent code drift, dark code testing.
Build-time code execution, supply chain injection, feature safety, reproducibility.
Ownership authority, interior mutability protocols, reference invalidation, synchronization.
Panic-as-DoS, panic safety for unsafe, unwind boundaries, cascading failures.
Verification methodology and tool gates: Miri, Loom, Proptest, Kani for risk anchors.
APM2 security contracts: typed IDs, secret redaction, state machines, atomic writes, identity boundaries, fail-closed defaults.
REQUIRED REASONING MODE: Attacker mindset — systematically discover exploitable weaknesses via attack trees and exploit paths.
REQUIRED REASONING MODE: Defender mindset — verify security claims are backed by traceable evidence, not just assertions.
REQUIRED REASONING MODE: Causal tracing — trace data flow through trust boundaries to identify where security invariants break.

nodes.purpose: Discover the CLI surface and materialize local review inputs.

steps.run: cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review prepare --help
cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review finding --help
cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review verdict set --help
cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review prepare --json

steps.if: prepare command fails OR diff_path is empty
steps.then: Jump to STEP_4_VERDICT with verdict=deny reason='prepare failed: no review inputs available'

nodes.purpose: Internalize all reference material and PR context before analysis.

steps.rule: Read every file listed in the references[] section IN FULL. Do not summarize, skip, or skim — details matter. Each reference contains threat vectors, invariants, checklists, and anti-patterns that are load-bearing for security review accuracy. Incomplete internalization produces false negatives.

steps.purpose: Full PR diff from prepare output

steps.rule: For each crate/module touched by the PR diff, locate and read its AGENTS.md (if it exists) in full. These contain module-specific invariants [INV-*] and contracts [CTR-*] whose violation constitutes a security finding.
Read additional RFC/ticket/security docs only when the diff references them or changes trust boundaries.

nodes.purpose: Apply required reasoning modes to the diff, emit each finding immediately.

modes_of_reasoning.instruction: Apply ALL three modes below to every changed trust boundary, handler, and data flow in the diff. The rust-standards references encode the invariants — these modes tell you HOW to reason about them.

modes.apply: For each changed surface: enumerate attacker goals, build attack trees, trace exploit paths from untrusted input to privileged effect. Every trust boundary crossing in the diff gets an attack tree.

For each security claim implied by the code (e.g. 'HMAC prevents tampering', 'capacity cap prevents DoS'): decompose into sub-claims, verify each sub-claim has traceable evidence in the diff or existing code. Unsubstantiated claims are findings.
For each changed component: trace the causal chain from input through internal state to output/side-effect. Identify where invariants could break under novel conditions not covered by the happy path.

emit_rule.action: For each finding, classify severity (BLOCKER, MAJOR, MINOR, NIT) and call:
emit_rule.command: cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review finding --type security --severity <severity> --summary "<one-line>" --risk "<threat and exploit path>" --impact "<blast radius and consequences>" --location "<file:line or module>" --body "<detailed description and required remediation>" --json
quality_rules: Each finding MUST include: summary, risk (threat + exploit path), impact (blast radius), location, and body (remediation).
If a handler has authority-bearing side effects but lacks AJC lifecycle enforcement, emit a MAJOR finding.
For prior-round findings that are now resolved, emit with --severity NIT and note the resolution in --body.

nodes.purpose: Set the verdict. This is the ONLY exit point — every execution path MUST reach this step.

then.run: cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review verdict set --dimension security --verdict approve --reason "PASS: no blocker or major findings" --json
cargo run -p apm2-cli -- fac review verdict set --dimension security --verdict deny --reason "FAIL: <blocker_count> blocker, <major_count> major findings" --json
